titles: To the Kings Most Excellent Majestie the humble petition of the countie of Cornvvall.
publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most Excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill,
notes: In this edition the eighth line of text begins: "verned".
Thanks King for laws and freedom, and for offer of general pardon. Asks him not to suffer them to fall under an arbitrary government, nor admit an alteration in religion. -- Steele.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  I, --  King of England, 1600-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
